Menlo Park, California-based GuideSpark is coming to Portland. 
The firm develops video content used by human resources professionals to help explain benefits, compensation, health care reform and other potentially complicated topics. 
"After an exhaustive search, we chose to set up business in Portland, a thriving city that met all of our criteria: an educated, innovative and technology-savvy workforce, combined with a stable and attractive business environment. We look forward to our continued expansion in Oregon," said GuideSpark CEO Keith Kitani, in a release. GuideSpark will set up a temporary office in the Pearl District's CNTRL Office co-working hub while a new office is built out in Southwest Portland, scheduled to open in 2016. The company says it plans to hire 230 workers in Portland within three years. It will receive a conditional $400,000 loan from the state of Oregon, requiring it to hire at least 200. 
"GuideSpark is a welcome addition to our region's thriving creative industries sector," said Jim Piro , Chairman of the Board for Greater Portland Inc. and president and CEO at Portland General Electric, in a statement. 
Economic development groups Greater Portland Inc., Business Oregon and Portland Development Commission helped make the announcement.
